Class Flowchart

  • java.lang.Object
    • dsl.Flowchart

  • class Flowchart
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    rongomai

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Flowchart.EdgeConsumer
      A functional interface to describe the action to be taken for each edge in a graph search of the flowchart.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.Set<Node> activeExplored
      Set of all nodes explored that refer to an action of the current character.
      private java.util.List<java.lang.Short> characterForMessage
      Maps each position to the sending character of the corresponding incoming message id.

      Maps character identifiers to their assigned ids.

      The first node to appear chronologically in the function being analyzed.

      Maps incoming message names to their assigned ids.
      private java.util.List<java.lang.Object> nextActions
      Maps each position to the next step to be taken after the corresponding message was received.

      Maps incoming messages to their NoReceiveException handlers.

      Maps outgoing message names to their assigned ids.
      private java.util.Map<Node,java.util.Set<Node>> reverse

      Indicates whether debug information should be displayed on screen.

    • Method Detail

      • getFirst

        public Node getFirst()
        Returns the first (top) node in the graph.
        Returns:
        the first node of the flowchart.

      • putEdge

        public void putEdge(Node from,
                    Node to,
                    Outcome outcome)
        Puts an edge on the flowchart. If the from node is null, the to node will be deemed to be the root of the graph.
        Parameters:
        from - the from node of the edge.
        to - the to node o the edge.
        outcome - the value of the edge.

      • doSearch

        public void doSearch(Flowchart.EdgeConsumer action)
        Does a BFS search on all nodes in the graph and executes an action with each edge.
        Parameters:
        action - the action to be performed on each edge.
        See Also:
        Flowchart.EdgeConsumer, doSearch(Predicate, EdgeConsumer)

      • doSearch

        public void doSearch(java.util.function.Predicate<Node> filter,
                     Flowchart.EdgeConsumer action)
        Does a BFS search on the nodes for which filter yields true and executes an action with each edge found.
        Parameters:
        filter - a condition under which nodes are included in the search.
        action - the action to be performed on each edge.
        See Also:
        Flowchart.EdgeConsumer, doSearch(EdgeConsumer)

      • copy

        public Flowchart copy()
        Returns a new copy of the flowchart.
        Returns:
        a new copy of the flowchart.

      • map

        public Flowchart map(java.util.function.Function<Node,Node> function)
        Maps the flowchart into a new flowchart using a mapping function given.
        Parameters:
        function - the mapping function.
        Returns:
        a new flowchart with the mapped nodes.

      • mapEnacts

        public void mapEnacts()
        Resolves enact nodes into the corresponding flowchart chunks recursively (deep resolve).

      • buildPart

        public Part buildPart(java.lang.String characterName,
                      java.lang.String protocolName,
                      java.lang.Class<?> actorClass,
                      Causality causality)
        Builds a part object for a given character.
        Parameters:
        characterName - the character identifier.
        protocolName - the name of the protocol.
        actorClass - the Actor class for which this protocol was intended.
        causality - the calculated causality graph for the protocol.
        Returns:
        a new part object.
        See Also:
        Part

      • searchMyActions

        private void searchMyActions(Node start)
        Does the part building search on nodes belonging to the given character. This method is called recursively from searchOthersActions.
        Parameters:
        start - the place to start the search from.
        See Also:
        searchOthersActions(Node, String), inscribeAndAdd(List, SendNode, String)

      • searchOthersActions

        private java.lang.Object searchOthersActions(Node start,
                                             java.lang.String characterName)
        Does the part building search on nodes not belonging to the given actor. This method is called recursively from searchMyActions and from itself.
        Parameters:
        start - the node to start the search from.
        characterName - the character identifier.
        Returns:
        either the next active node to be executed or a collection of next messages to be received.
        See Also:
        searchMyActions(Node)

      • inscribeAndAdd

        private void inscribeAndAdd(java.util.List<java.lang.Short> nextMessagesList,
                            SendNode sendNode,
                            java.lang.String characterName)
        Adds an incoming message to the part description. If the message is new, gives it a new id and inscribes its sender too, if necessary. Additionally, it puts it in the next message graph and inscribes its NoRceiveException handler if any is supplied.

        This function has two recursions: one for the

        Parameters:
        nextMessagesList - a list of next messages from a preceding message.
        sendNode - a node corresponding to an incoming message;
        characterName - the name of the current character.
        See Also:
        searchOthersActions(Node, String)
